intro: Linosyris australis, commonly known as the Australian linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Linosyris australis typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a hardy species adapted to low rainfall and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
